intro: Haplopappus racemosus var. glomeratus, commonly known as the clustered globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and produces yellow flowers with five petals. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in dry, rocky soils. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Its botanical features make it well adapted to arid environments and suitable for xeriscaping.
